data.text: @fvandenburg @LArtdelInfusion @nb_covid_info @HallwayOrchard That is correct. There are also notifiable events. The law confers an obligation to report certain things. Notifiable diseases are simply a class of diseases that trigger certain things to occur or additional powers. Prior Public Health Act used some different terms.
@fvandenburg @HallwayOrchard @nb_covid_info @SkinnerLyle And this is where we will be directed to to find info that we are used to see on the dashboard?

@HallwayOrchard @LArtdelInfusion @nb_covid_info @SkinnerLyle The problem seems to be that while DoH has to make a public declaration about a notifiable disease, it isn't widely known that you can go look it all up on the CMOH website too, past & current. Navigation isn't a treat, but you can find info if you hunt.

https://t.co/RBCBIK453n
@fvandenburg @LArtdelInfusion @nb_covid_info @SkinnerLyle Thanks Frank… was definitely thrown by the “other as described in the regulations”
@LArtdelInfusion @nb_covid_info @SkinnerLyle BC does an excellent job with clear legislation by comparison to ours.

@nb_covid_info @HallwayOrchard @SkinnerLyle Here are the notable differences I found on the BC website, couldn't find something as clear on our province's 🤷🏼‍♀️ https://t.co/J0YYLJt260 https://t.co/WuwfZWOg8G
@HallwayOrchard @SkinnerLyle @LArtdelInfusion What is the difference between reportable and notifiable? Thank you for your time!

@SkinnerLyle @LArtdelInfusion @nb_covid_info Interesting. I was conflating “reportable” and “notifiable”. 

Thank you for this clarification!
